result.execSummary:
All charges against Leequinace Giovann Turner in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leequinace Giovann Turner is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leequinace Giovann Turner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Leequinace Giovann Turner.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED OUTRIGHT.

Defendant Leequinace G Turner in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Leequinace G Turner.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defense is requesting an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. Court grants, case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defendant appears by Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Pettersen. Court took judicial notice of 22CF311.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Leequinace Giovann Turner in custody. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leequinace Giovann Turner appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant has lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
